LCI.pantos module

LCI.pantos.erase_txt(image, blur=True)[source]

Process an image by either blurring or covering text regions with black rectangles.

This function takes an image. If text with a probability greater than 0.5 is detected, it applies blurring or covers the text with a black rectangle. If no such text is found, it returns the original image.

Parameters:

  • img (numpy.ndarray) – The input image to be processed.

  • blur (bool, optional) – If True, blur the detected text regions; otherwise, cover them with black rectangles. Default is True.

Returns:

The processed image.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Example

img = cv2.imread(“image.jpg”) processed_img = proc_img(img, blur=True)

class LCI.pantos.lci_db(cred_path, name='lci')[source]

Bases: object

collections()[source]

Retrieves a list of collection names from the Firestore database.

Returns:

A list of collection names.

Return type:

list of str

Example

lci = lci_db(“path/to/credentials.json”)

collection_names = lci.collections()

download_images(file_list, dst_folder)[source]

Download images from a list of Firestore document references and save them to a destination folder.

Parameters:

  • file_list (list) – A list of Firestore document references.

  • dst_folder (str) – The destination folder where images will be saved.

Returns:

None

Example

lci = lci_db(“path/to/credentials.json”)

collection_list = lci.query_collection

collection_name = collection_list[0]

query_results = lci.raw_query(collection_name)

dst_folder = “path/to/destination_folder”

lci.download_images(query_results,dst_folder)

download_images_and_json(file_list, dst_folder)[source]

Download images and JSON files from URLs and save them to the filesystem. Also save a csv and xlsx file with the info from each file.

Parameters:

  • file_list (list) – A list of Firestore document references.

  • dst_folder (str) – The destination folder where images and JSON files will be saved.

Returns:

None

Example

lci = lci_db(“path/to/credentials.json”)

collection_list = lci.query_collection

collection_name = collection_list[0]

query_results = lci.raw_query(collection_name)

dst_folder = “path/to/destination_folder”

lci.download_images_and_json(query_results,dst_folder)

download_jsons(file_list, dst_folder)[source]

Download JSON files from a list of Firestore document references and save them to a destination folder.

Parameters:

  • file_list (list) – A list of Firestore document references.

  • dst_folder (str) – The destination folder where JSON files will be saved.

Returns:

None

Example

lci = lci_db(“path/to/credentials.json”)

collection_list = lci.query_collection

collection_name = collection_list[0]

query_results = lci.raw_query(collection_name)

dst_folder = “path/to/destination_folder”

lci.download_json(query_results,dst_folder)

filt_query(func)[source]

Filters the data in the current query collection based on a given function.

Parameters:

func (callable) – A function that defines the filter condition.

Returns:

A list of items that satisfy the filter condition.

Return type:

list

Example

lci = lci_db(“path/to/credentials.json”)

# Define a filter function, e.g., lambda item: item[‘field’] == ‘value’

filtered_data = lci.filt_query(func)

generate_csv(file_list)[source]

Generate a Pandas DataFrame with specific columns from Firestore document data.

Parameters:

file_list (list) – A list of Firestore document references.

Returns:

A DataFrame containing selected columns from the document data.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

Example

lci = lci_db(“path/to/credentials.json”)

file_list = lci.query_collection

dataframe = lci.generate_csv(file_list)

raw_query(collection_name)[source]

Perform queries to Firestore and combine results without duplicates.

Parameters:

collection_name (str) – The name of the Firestore collection to query.

Returns:

A list of combined results.

Return type:

list

Example

lci = lci_db(“path/to/credentials.json”)

collection_name = “example_collection”

query_results = lci.raw_query(collection_name)

count()[source]

Count the occurrences of OTA categories in the dataset.

Returns:

A Series containing category counts.

Return type:

pandas.Series

Example

category_counts = ota.count()

ota2df()[source]

Convert OTA shapefiles in the specified folder to a single DataFrame.

Returns:

A DataFrame containing OTA data with ‘x’, ‘y’, and ‘cls’ columns.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

Example

ota_df = ota.ota2df()

ota2df_by_file(file_path, cls)[source]

Convert a shapefile (.shp) to a DataFrame with columns ‘x’, ‘y’, and ‘cls’.

Parameters:

  • file_path (str) – The path to the .shp file.

  • cls (str) – The class.

Returns:

A DataFrame with ‘x’, ‘y’, and ‘cls’ columns.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

Example

df = ota.ota2df_by_file(“path/to/shapefile.shp”, “cachorro”)

plot()[source]

Create an interactive plot showing the OTA data overlaid on an image.

Example

ota.plot()

LCI.utils module

LCI.utils.copy_file(file_path, dest_path)[source]

Copy a file from a source path to a destination path.

Parameters:

  • file_path (str) – The path of the file to be copied.

  • dest_path (str) – The destination directory where the file will be copied.

Raises:

  • FileNotFoundError – If the source file does not exist.

  • PermissionError – If permission is denied to copy the file.

  • Exception – For any other unexpected errors during the copy process.

Returns:

This function does not return a value.

Return type:

None

Example

copy_file(“/source_directory/example.txt”, “/destination_directory/”)

LCI.utils.decode_image(base64_image_data)[source]

Decode a base64-encoded image data and return a PIL Image object.

Parameters:

base64_image_data (str) – Base64-encoded image data.

Returns:

A PIL Image object.

Return type:

PIL.Image.Image

Example

image_data = “base64_encoded_image_data_here”

image = decode_image(image_data)

LCI.utils.drive_colab()[source]

Mount Google Drive in a Google Colab environment and set up authentication.

This function mounts the Google Drive file system in a Google Colab environment and sets up authentication to access Google Drive using PyDrive.

Parameters:

None –

Returns:

None

Example

drive_colab()

LCI.utils.encode_image()[source]

Encode an image as base64.

Parameters:

image_path (str) – The path to the image file to be encoded.

Returns:

Base64-encoded image data.

Return type:

str

Example

image_path = “path/to/your_image.jpg”

base64_image_data = encode_image(image_path)

LCI.utils.install_package(package_name)[source]

Install a Python package if it is not already installed.

This function attempts to import the specified package. If the package is not installed, it uses pip to install it. If the installation fails, it prompts the user to install the package manually.

Parameters:

package_name (str) – The name of the Python package to be installed.

Returns:

None

Example

install_package(“numpy”)

LCI.utils.move_file(file_path, dst_path)[source]

Move a file from the source path to the destination path.

This function copies a file from the source path to the destination path using the ‘copy_file’ function and then removes the file from the source path.

Parameters:

  • file_path (str) – The path to the file to be moved.

  • dst_path (str) – The destination directory where the file will be moved.

Returns:

None

Example

move_file(“/source_directory/example.txt”, “/destination_directory/”)
